text:
The keystore file format allows (and keytool encourages) multiple keys in a 
keystore file, with each key encrypted with a different password. It should be 
possible to specify an SSLServerSocketFactory that deals with a keystore file 
that has these properties (currently, it just uses the first key in the file.)
creator: cman@io.com
remm@apache.org
text: As voted in the release plan, will be addressed later.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Features are nice, but when noone uses them, they are just useless. The current 
behavior matches other crypto systems behavior, and there's too much legacy to 
change it.
